Key Match Events: LeBron James scored 16 points in a three-minute span in the fourth quarter to help the Lakers to a 131-127 win over the Sacramento Kings.
The Lakers went on a 21-0 run to start the fourth quarter, scoring 11 straight points by James.
Anthony Davis hit a 3-pointer and a free throw in the final minute to secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: LeBron James stressed that the Lakers are a team and not reliant on him scoring for four quarters.
Post-Match Reflections: James was relatively quiet in the first two games but showed his greatness again, scoring 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Anthony Davis put up 31 points and tied a franchise record for the most consecutive 30-point games to start the season.
Lakers coach JJ Redick praised James' ability to continue performing at a high level.
